head.title: Brackets - The Free, Open Source Code Editor for the Web

hero.description: Brackets is an open source code editor for web designers and front-end developers.

os-alert.general: Unfortunately, we don't support __os__ any longer. Take a look at the Requirements.
os-alert.win-xp: Unfortunately, we don't support Windows XP any longer. Read our blog post for further information.
os-alert.debian-7: Unfortunately, we currently don't support Debian 7. Take a look at the GitHub issue for further information.

live-html.content: As you code, HTML changes are instantly pushed to browser without having to save or reload the page.

theseus.content: Theseus makes inspecting variables and control flow easy, even in asynchronous code.

linux.content: Over the last few releases we’ve made progress on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) support for Brackets.

dev.content: Imagine the ability to fluently edit external styles and code without even leaving your document!

in-browser.content: Brackets doesn't get in the way of your creative process. It blends visual tools into the editor while pushing HTML and CSS to the browser as you code.

experience.content: Brackets isn't just pretty, it's also powerful. You'll enjoy writing code in Brackets. It will stay out of your way and provide just the right amount of help when you ask for it.

love-and-js.content: Brackets is an open-source project, with an active and growing developer community. It's made by other web developers like you!

evolving.content: Brackets is a sandbox for trying out new ideas for web tooling. New features and extensions are released every 2.5 weeks. It's like getting presents all year long.

list: Mac OS X v10.6, v10.7, v10.8 or v10.9
256MB of RAM (2GB of RAM for Live Development)
200MB of available hard-disk space for installation
Intel® Pentium® 4 or AMD Athlon® 64 processor
256MB of RAM (2GB of RAM for Live Development)
200MB of available hard-disk space for installation
Save the installer file to a location on your hard drive.
Locate the installer and double-click to start the install process.

updates.content: New features in Brackets are released often (about every 2½ weeks). When new features are available you will see a gift icon inside the application. For the latest release information, follow Brackets on __twitter__ or __googlePlus__.

hero.content: Brackets is an open source code editor that is fun to hack on and easy to contribute to. The Brackets project is a community sandbox where everyone is invited to experiment with new ideas for web tooling.

get-source.content: Brackets is one of the most popular projects on GitHub. Fork the project and join the community.

setup-env.content: Read our detailed instructions for setting up a development environment and get hacking right away.

extension.content: Building a Brackets extension is the easiest way to experiment with new ideas and share them with the community.

translate.content: Brackets is available in 25+ languages that are contributed and maintained by the community.

starter-issues.description: Just getting started? Starter issues are bite-sized bugs that shouldn't take more than an hour or two to complete. They are a great way to learn the codebase and make a difference.

starter-features.description: Ready for something bigger? Starter features are small ideas that won't require a big time commitment. You should be able to complete one in a couple weeknights or over a weekend.
